instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
Hello,

I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in with liquid/corrosion around <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> area and does not display video to internal but does to external.
I have cleaned, replaced <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> and tested with a working display. All components in the area measure correct but I am not getting <SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL>.
Can someone tell me what the PCH needs to output that signal, or any information on how this circuit works would help.

Thanks,

Mike

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message: Is <SIGNAL>EDP_PANEL_PWR</SIGNAL> present?  Are <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C8329</CAPACITOR> & FL8300-FL8303 in place?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
Yes, EDP_ PANEL_ PWR is present and <CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR>-<CAPACITOR>C8329</CAPACITOR> & FL8300-FL8303 are in place.

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message: Voltage at L8300 present? Did you test with a known good LCD from the correct year(2014)?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
Hello Duke,

No <SIGNAL>LCD_PSR_EN</SIGNAL> so 0 Volts on L8300. I did test with a known good working LCD. Correct me if I am wrong but isn't <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> a 2015 board. I have a known good LCD for 2013-2014 I can try if I am incorrect.

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message: Yeah sorry it is 2015. The problem is that there should be a short pulse on L8300. This enables the system to identify the LCD. If there is no LCD detected it will go low again. So you cannot just check these signals after you turned it on. Check for a pulse on <SIGNAL>PSR_EN</SIGNAL>, preferably with a scope as multimeter may be too slow to catch. Check soldering on <CHIP>U8330</CHIP> again and check if 3V is on pin 8.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
OK, I will check this tomorrow and get back with results.

Thanks

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message: Yup, there is a pulse but voltage was not getting through <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>. Replaced and cleaned corroded pads and all is good with test LCD. Original LCD has a short on <SIGNAL>PP5VR3V3_SW_LCD</SIGNAL>. Do you think short could be in the display cable or is LCD shot?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
Coonect only the cable.
If short persists, display should be good.
Don't power the unit; only check in diode mode...
LCD should have internal fuse in that rail.
So probably you have bad cable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no internal video
threads.message:
No short with only cable connected. Signs of liquid in the display also.
Thanks for the help Duke and 2Informaticos.
